required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: This non-interventional, post-marketing observational study was conducted to obtain data, such as safety and effectiveness, from the use of lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra) in clinical practice and investigate the necessity to conduct a follow-up post-marketing clinical study in Japan.

primary_outcome.measure: Total Number of Patients With Adverse Drug Reactions
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the course of the survey period up to Year 8
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients with adverse drug reactions, defined as adverse events for which the causal relationship with Kaletra was something other than "not related" by the investigator (i.e., "probable," "possible," or "unclear"), that occurred in ≥ 5% of patients. Adverse drug reactions are reported by preferred term and inclusive of all those reported at each visit. Although a patient may experience a particular preferred term more than once, each patient was counted only once for each preferred term.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Month 0), every 3 months thereafter up to Month 12 and every year thereafter up to Year 8 (Month 96) during the course of the survey period
primary_outcome.description: The evolution of patients' CD4-positive (CD4+) T-lymphocyte counts after starting treatment with Kaletra was assessed by measuring the number of CD4+ cells at baseline and each subsequent study visit. CD4+ counts are reported as the number of CD4+ cells per cubic millimeter (cmm) and presented by the mean at each visit. Only observed cases were included in analyses; no data were imputed. n = xx, xx is the number of patients naive to previous antiretroviral treatment and those that were not who had CD4+ T-cell counts available for analysis at each study visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) Copies Per Milliliter (mL) Using a Logarithmic (Base 10) Transformation at Each Visit
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Month 0), every 3 months thereafter up to Month 12 and every year thereafter up to Year 8 (Month 96) during the course of the survey period
primary_outcome.description: Number of HIV RNA copies per mL is presented by the mean per visit for patients that were naive to previous antiretroviral treatment and those that were not. HIV-RNA data reported as < 400 copies/mL were considered 399 copies/mL in calculations. The mean and standard deviation of HIV-RNA levels were thus calculated after logarithmic (base 10) transformation (log10 399 is 2.6). Only observed cases were included in analyses; no data were imputed. n = xx, xx is the number of treatment-naive, treatment-experienced participants who had CD4+ T-cell counts available for analysis at each study visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Included in Each Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Classification Category for HIV-infected Adults and Adolescents
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Month 0) and following last treatment dose during the course of the survey period
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients in each CDC category at Baseline (last assessment within 30 days prior to first dose of Kaletra) and after treatment. CDC categories defined as: Category A (asymptomatic acute HIV infection), Category B (symptomatic HIV infection; not Categories A and C), Category C (acquired immunodeficiency syndrome [AIDS] indicator status), Class P-0 (children not confirmed for HIV infection), Class P-1 (children with asymptomatic HIV infection), or Class P-2 (children with symptomatic HIV infection).

arm_group.description: All patients in this non-interventional, post-marketing observational study, who were prescribed lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra) in accordance with the local Prescribing Information for the treatment of HIV infection.

intervention.description: Lopinavir/ritonavir evaluated separately in patients who were naive to previous antiretroviral treatment and those who were not.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients prescribed Kaletra for the treatment of HIV are eligible for this survey.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications according to the Package Insert:
- Patients with a history of hypersensitivity to any ingredient of Kaletra
- Patients who are receiving pimozide, cisapride, ergotamine tartrate, dihydroergotamine mesylate, ergometrine maleate, methylergometrine maleate, midazolam, triazolam, vardenafil hydrochloride hydrate, boriconazol

group.title: Lopinavir/Ritonavir Group
group.description: All patients in this non-interventional, post-marketing observational study, who were prescribed lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra) in accordance with the local Prescribing Information for the treatment of HIV infection.

group.title: Lopinavir/Ritonavir Group
group.description: All patients in this non-interventional, post-marketing observational study, who were prescribed lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra) in accordance with the local Prescribing Information for the treatment of HIV infection.

outcome.title: Total Number of Patients With Adverse Drug Reactions
outcome.description: Number of patients with adverse drug reactions, defined as adverse events for which the causal relationship with Kaletra was something other than "not related" by the investigator (i.e., "probable," "possible," or "unclear"), that occurred in ≥ 5% of patients. Adverse drug reactions are reported by preferred term and inclusive of all those reported at each visit. Although a patient may experience a particular preferred term more than once, each patient was counted only once for each preferred term.
outcome.time_frame: During the course of the survey period up to Year 8
outcome.population: Available data for all patients were included.

group.title: Lopinavir/Ritonavir Group
group.description: All patients in this non-interventional, post-marketing observational study, who were prescribed lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra) in accordance with the local Prescribing Information for the treatment of HIV infection.

measure.title: Total Number of Patients With Adverse Drug Reactions
measure.description: Number of patients with adverse drug reactions, defined as adverse events for which the causal relationship with Kaletra was something other than "not related" by the investigator (i.e., "probable," "possible," or "unclear"), that occurred in ≥ 5% of patients. Adverse drug reactions are reported by preferred term and inclusive of all those reported at each visit. Although a patient may experience a particular preferred term more than once, each patient was counted only once for each preferred term.
measure.population: Available data for all patients were included.

outcome.title: Cluster of Differentiation 4 Lymphocyte Count (CD4)
outcome.description: The evolution of patients' CD4-positive (CD4+) T-lymphocyte counts after starting treatment with Kaletra was assessed by measuring the number of CD4+ cells at baseline and each subsequent study visit. CD4+ counts are reported as the number of CD4+ cells per cubic millimeter (cmm) and presented by the mean at each visit. Only observed cases were included in analyses; no data were imputed. n = xx, xx is the number of patients naive to previous antiretroviral treatment and those that were not who had CD4+ T-cell counts available for analysis at each study visit.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Month 0), every 3 months thereafter up to Month 12 and every year thereafter up to Year 8 (Month 96) during the course of the survey period
outcome.population: Available data at each visit for each subgroup of patients who had not received and received prior antiretroviral drug therapy were included in the analyses. Data for patients for whom either baseline or treatment data were missing for a given visit were excluded from the analysis for that visit.

group.title: Lopinavir/Ritonavir: Treatment-Naive
group.description: The subgroup of patients who had not received prior antiretroviral drug therapy. Data for patients for whom either baseline data or data during treatment were missing for a given time point were excluded from the analysis for that time point. Of the 1184 total enrolled patients, 416 patients had baseline data and efficacy data for this outcome measure, and were therefore included in the analysis.

group.title: Lopinavir/Ritonavir: Treatment-Experienced
group.description: The subgroup of patients who have received prior antiretroviral drug therapy. Data for patients for whom either baseline data or data during treatment were missing for a given time point were excluded from the analysis for that time point. Of the 1184 total enrolled patients, 420 patients had baseline data and efficacy data for this outcome measure, and were therefore included in the analysis.

measure.title: Cluster of Differentiation 4 Lymphocyte Count (CD4)
measure.description: The evolution of patients' CD4-positive (CD4+) T-lymphocyte counts after starting treatment with Kaletra was assessed by measuring the number of CD4+ cells at baseline and each subsequent study visit. CD4+ counts are reported as the number of CD4+ cells per cubic millimeter (cmm) and presented by the mean at each visit. Only observed cases were included in analyses; no data were imputed. n = xx, xx is the number of patients naive to previous antiretroviral treatment and those that were not who had CD4+ T-cell counts available for analysis at each study visit.
measure.population: Available data at each visit for each subgroup of patients who had not received and received prior antiretroviral drug therapy were included in the analyses. Data for patients for whom either baseline or treatment data were missing for a given visit were excluded from the analysis for that visit.

measurement_list.measurement: No data were recorded for any patients at this visit.

outcome.title: Mean Number of Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) Copies Per Milliliter (mL) Using a Logarithmic (Base 10) Transformation at Each Visit
outcome.description: Number of HIV RNA copies per mL is presented by the mean per visit for patients that were naive to previous antiretroviral treatment and those that were not. HIV-RNA data reported as < 400 copies/mL were considered 399 copies/mL in calculations. The mean and standard deviation of HIV-RNA levels were thus calculated after logarithmic (base 10) transformation (log10 399 is 2.6). Only observed cases were included in analyses; no data were imputed. n = xx, xx is the number of treatment-naive, treatment-experienced participants who had CD4+ T-cell counts available for analysis at each study visit.

outcome.population: Available data at each visit for each subgroup of patients who had not received and who had received prior antiretroviral drug therapy were included in the analyses. Data for patients for whom either baseline data or treatment data were missing for a given visit were excluded from the analysis for that visit.

Of the 1184 total enrolled patients, 416 patients had baseline data and efficacy data for this outcome measure, and were therefore included in the analysis.

Data for patients for whom either baseline data or data during treatment were missing for a given time point were excluded from the analysis for that time point. Of the 1184 total enrolled patients, 418 patients had baseline data and efficacy data for this outcome measure, and were therefore included in the analysis.

HIV-RNA data reported as < 400 copies/mL were considered 399 copies/mL in calculations. The mean and standard deviation of HIV-RNA levels were thus calculated after logarithmic (base 10) transformation (log10 399 is 2.6). measurement_list.measurement: No data were recorded for any patients at this visit.

outcome.title: Number of Patients Included in Each Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Classification Category for HIV-infected Adults and Adolescents
outcome.description: Number of patients in each CDC category at Baseline (last assessment within 30 days prior to first dose of Kaletra) and after treatment. CDC categories defined as: Category A (asymptomatic acute HIV infection), Category B (symptomatic HIV infection; not Categories A and C), Category C (acquired immunodeficiency syndrome [AIDS] indicator status), Class P-0 (children not confirmed for HIV infection), Class P-1 (children with asymptomatic HIV infection), or Class P-2 (children with symptomatic HIV infection).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Month 0) and following last treatment dose during the course of the survey period
outcome.population: Available data for all patients were included.

group.title: Lopinavir/Ritonavir: Baseline Category A
group.description: The subgroup of patients who were classified as CDC Category A at Baseline (prior to treatment with lopinavir/ritonavir).

group.title: Lopinavir/Ritonavir: Baseline Category B
group.description: The subgroup of participants who were classified as CDC Category B at Baseline (prior to treatment with lopinavir/ritonavir).

group.title: Lopinavir/Ritonavir: Baseline Category C
group.description: The subgroup of patients who were classified as CDC Category C at Baseline (prior to treatment with lopinavir/ritonavir).

group.title: Lopinavir/Ritonavir: Baseline Category P-0
group.description: The subgroup of participants who were classified as CDC Category P-0 at Baseline (prior to treatment with lopinavir/ritonavir).

group.title: Lopinavir/Ritonavir: Baseline Category P-1
group.description: The subgroup of participants who were classified as CDC Category P-1 at Baseline (prior to treatment with lopinavir/ritonavir).

group.title: Lopinavir/Ritonavir: Baseline Category P-2
group.description: The subgroup of participants who were classified as CDC Category P-2 at Baseline (prior to treatment with lopinavir/ritonavir).

group.title: Lopinavir/Ritonavir: Baseline Category Unknown
group.description: The subgroup of participants whose CDC classification at Baseline (prior to treatment with lopinavir/ritonavir) was unknown.

measure.title: Number of Patients Included in Each Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Classification Category for HIV-infected Adults and Adolescents
measure.description: Number of patients in each CDC category at Baseline (last assessment within 30 days prior to first dose of Kaletra) and after treatment. CDC categories defined as: Category A (asymptomatic acute HIV infection), Category B (symptomatic HIV infection; not Categories A and C), Category C (acquired immunodeficiency syndrome [AIDS] indicator status), Class P-0 (children not confirmed for HIV infection), Class P-1 (children with asymptomatic HIV infection), or Class P-2 (children with symptomatic HIV infection).
measure.population: Available data for all patients were included.

reported_events.time_frame: During the course of the survey period up to Year 8.
reported_events.desc: Adverse drug reactions (ADRs) for Primary Outcome Measure 1, defined as AEs (a) for which the causal relationship with Kaletra was other than 'not related' (including 'unclear') and (b) which occurred in > 5% of patients, were summarized from the list of AEs below. ADRs are inclusive of all such events reported at each visit.

group.title: Lopinavir/Ritonavir Group
group.description: All patients in this non-interventional, post-marketing observational study, who were prescribed lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra) in accordance with the local Prescribing Information for the treatment of HIV infection.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Abbott requests that any investigator or institution that plans on presenting/publishing results disclosure, provide written notification of their request 60 days prior to their presentation/publication. Abbott requests that no presentation/publication will be instituted until 12 months after a study is completed, or after the first presentation/publication whichever occurs first. A delay may be proposed of a presentation/publication if Abbott needs to secure patent or proprietary protection.
